topic.title: Configuring Web Author Logging in Content Fusion

body.p:
To configure logging for the built-in visual editor, follow these steps:
Connect to the Content Fusion Enterprise machine over SSH (for example, if you use VMware vSphere, see Deploying Content Fusion Enterprise Using VMware vSphere).
Edit the log4j.properties file from the Web Author Docker container and then restart that container.
Run the following commands with administrator privileges:
sudo su
cd /fusion
Copy the log4j.properties file from the Web Author Docker container to the host:docker cp "$(docker-compose ps -q webauthor)": /tomcat/webapps/oxygen-xml-web-author/WEB-INF/log4j.properties log4j.properties
Open this (log4j.properties) file in an editor to add lines to enable additional logging. Once you have finished editing the file, you can copy it to the Web Author container with:
docker cp log4j.properties "$(docker-compose ps -q webauthor)": /tomcat/webapps/oxygen-xml-web-author/WEB-INF/log4j.properties
Restart the Web Author Docker container to apply the changes:docker-compose restart webauthor
[Optional] To verify the content of the log4j.properties file, you can run:
docker-compose exec webauthor cat /tomcat/webapps/oxygen-xml-web-author/WEB-INF/log4j.properties
These changes will be lost in case the Web Author Docker container is re-created.
[Optional] If you have not changed the default docker log driver, you can see the live feed of logs by running:docker-compose logs --follow webauthor
It will block your current console until you press Ctrl+C (Command+C on OS X).
